name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
overview: Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, narrates his experiences and struggles with growing up.
summary: Holden Caulfield recounts his experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

name: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
overview: Sethe, an escaped slave, is haunted by the ghost of her dead daughter in post-Civil War Ohio.
summary: Sethe's life is disrupted by the arrival of a mysterious young woman who calls herself Beloved.

author: George Orwell
overview: In a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother, Winston Smith struggles with oppression and control.
summary: Winston Smith navigates life under a repressive regime that monitors and controls every aspect of life.

name: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
overview: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic landscape, struggling to survive.
summary: A father and son navigate a bleak, post-apocalyptic world, facing numerous challenges along the way.

name: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
overview: Theo Decker survives an explosion at a museum and becomes obsessed with a painting called The Goldfinch.
summary: Theo Decker's life is forever changed after he survives a terrorist attack at a museum and steals a priceless painting.

name: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
overview: In a dystopian future, women are subjugated and forced into reproductive servitude.
summary: Offred, a Handmaid in the Republic of Gilead, navigates a world of strict social classes and reproductive control.

name: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
overview: A young boy named Pi survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.
summary: Pi Patel recounts his extraordinary journey of survival and faith while stranded in the Pacific Ocean.

name: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
overview: During World War II, a young girl named Liesel steals books and shares them with her neighbors in Nazi Germany.
summary: Liesel Meminger's life is changed forever as she navigates the horrors of Nazi Germany with the help of her foster parents and a hidden Jewish man.

name: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
overview: Amir, a young boy from a wealthy family in Kabul, forms a deep friendship with Hassan, his servant's son.
summary: Amir's journey of redemption and forgiveness as he returns to Afghanistan to rescue Hassan's son.

name: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
overview: A magical competition between two young illusionists unfolds within the mysterious Night Circus.
summary: Celia and Marco, two young illusionists, are bound by a magical competition that takes place within the enchanting Night Circus.
awards: Locus Award for Best First Novel

name: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
overview: The story of Celie, an African American woman in the early 20th century, who overcomes oppression and abuse to find her own voice.
summary: Celie's journey from a life of hardship to self-discovery and empowerment, told through letters she writes to God.

name: Atonement
author: Ian McEwan
overview: A young girl's false accusation changes the lives of two lovers and her own family forever.
summary: Briony Tallis's misunderstanding and subsequent accusation lead to a lifetime of guilt and a quest for atonement.

name: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
author: Junot DÃ­az
overview: Oscar, a Dominican boy growing up in New Jersey, dreams of becoming a writer and finding love, while dealing with a family curse.
summary: Oscar's quest for love and literary success is intertwined with his family's tragic history and the curse that haunts them.

name: The Underground Railroad
author: Colson Whitehead
overview: Cora, a slave on a cotton plantation in Georgia, escapes via the Underground Railroad, a literal network of tracks and tunnels.
summary: Cora's journey to freedom is fraught with danger and discovery as she navigates the Underground Railroad.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
overview: Scout Finch, a young girl living in Alabama during the 1930s, learns about racism and prejudice as her father defends a black man on trial for rape.
summary: Scout Finch observes racial injustice in her hometown as her father defends a black man on trial for a crime he didn't commit.

name: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell
overview: Cloud Atlas is a complex and interwoven story that spans centuries and continents, following the lives of various characters connected through time and their actions.
summary: Six narratives intertwine across time, exploring themes of reincarnation, fate, and the interconnectedness of humanity.

name: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: In the sixth installment of the Harry Potter series, Harry uncovers a mysterious textbook and delves deeper into Voldemort's past while facing new threats at Hogwarts.
summary: Harry grapples with teenage romance, dark secrets, and preparing for the inevitable battle against Voldemort.
awards: British Book Awards - Children's Book of the Year

name: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: The final installment of the Harry Potter series, where Harry, Ron, and Hermione embark on a dangerous quest to destroy Voldemort and end his reign of terror.
summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione face their greatest challenge yet as they search for and destroy Voldemort's Horcruxes.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: Orphaned Harry Potter learns on his eleventh birthday that he is the orphaned son of two powerful wizards and possesses unique magical powers of his own. He is summoned from his life as an unwanted child by his parents' friend Albus Dumbledore, a powerful sorcerer and headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, to become a student.

name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: Harry Potter returns to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for his second year, only to find the school has been under attack by a mysterious force that seems to be connected to a dark secret from Hogwarts' past.

name: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: Harry Potter embarks on his third year at Hogwarts, where a dangerous convicted murderer, Sirius Black, escapes from Azkaban prison. Harry soon learns that Black may be connected to his parents' deaths.

name: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: Harry Potter finds himself competing in the Triwizard Tournament, a dangerous magical competition between three prestigious schools of witchcraft and wizardry. However, when Harry's name is mysteriously selected as the fourth competitor, he faces a series of dangerous challenges and a growing darkness.

name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
author: J.K. Rowling
overview: Harry Potter discovers that the Ministry of Magic is under the control of Lord Voldemort, a powerful dark wizard. Harry must also confront the challenges of growing up and dealing with the emotional turmoil of adolescence.
